news_header: Robotic machines in Edinburgh are transforming fatbergs into a pine-scented chemical for perfumes, showcasing advancements in bioengineering.
news_text: In Edinburgh, robotic machines are converting fatbergs—massive clumps of fat found in sewers—into a pine-smelling chemical for use in perfumes. This innovative process highlights the potential of bioengineering to recycle waste sustainably. While the UK has been a leader in this field, recent investment and regulatory challenges threaten its position. Experts warn that without proper funding and public trust, the benefits of this technology may not be realized. The government has recognized the importance of engineering biology but needs to ensure adequate support to maintain leadership in this rapidly evolving sector.
